executive_summary: Paint wholesalers have been on the decline over the past five years. Firstly, global economic uncertainty led to a decrease in consumer and business spending on nonessential items, including new paint jobs. With individuals and businesses tightening their budgets, there was reduced demand for paint and related products amid the COVID-19 pandemic. More recently, the

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Wholesalers are Being Cut Out of the Supply Chain
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The housing market has witnessed a slowdown, with fewer home sales and new construction projects taking place as interest rates have risen, beginning in 2022. As paint purchases are closely tied to these activities, the decrease in housing market activity directly impacts the need for paint, leading to a decline in sales to paint stores. Industry revenue decreased at an expected CAGR of 1.9% to reach an estimated $19.8 billion in 2024, including an increase of 1.4% in 2024 alone.

Paint wholesalers have been negatively affected by shifting distribution channels. Advancements in technology and improved logistics have made it easier for manufacturers to establish direct relationships with retailers, cutting out the need for intermediary wholesalers. By selling directly, manufacturers can exercise more control over their products, pricing and brand image. Manufacturers have recognized the potential profitability of establishing their own retail sales teams and outlets.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Wholesalers have concentrated on consolidating the market
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Wholesalers have concentrated on consolidating the market by focusing on increasing their market share through acquisition activity. Large operators have been able to maintain their competitiveness by streamlining their distribution networks and enhancing their online ordering and just-in-time inventory management systems.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Broader Paint Industry Has Seen Positive Trends
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Per capita disposable income and private spending on home improvements have risen in recent years, benefiting overall downstream demand for paint, though wholesalers have not captured all of this growth. Over the five years through 2024, overall demand from car body shops and the industrial production index have both seen overall growth, driving demand for paint.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: There Will Be Growing Paint Usage Among Consumers
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Given the widespread use of paint-related products, demand for paints and industry services is likely to rise with any significant expansion of the manufacturing, construction or industrial sectors. For instance, industrial

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Wholesalers Will Continue to Contend With Increased Levels of Internal Competition
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Future industry growth is anticipated to be steady, but operators will likely still have to deal with heightened internal competition. Large-scale paint producers are increasingly forgoing distribution agreements with wholesalers and selling directly to retailers and end users, particularly PPG Industries and Sherwin-Williams.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Paint Wholesalers Will Look to Maximize Sales
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Wholesale companies will seek strategies to increase sales to maintain profit and effectively compete with in-house sales teams. This could mean

industry_definition: Operators in this industry wholesale paints, wallpaper, paintbrushes, rollers and other related products. Industry operators purchase paint and other coatings from manufacturers for resale to downstream customers; they do not generally manufacture paint themselves. Retail sales outlets of paint manufacturers are not included in this industry; however, manufacturers' internal wholesale divisions are included in this industry.
key_trends: Paint wholesalers compete with one another on a number of different levels. Wholesale distributors can set themselves apart from their rivals by being effective and offering value-added services like warranties, technical assistance or equipment repair.

Sherwin-Williams and PPG Industries are key players in the industry that are vertically integrated businesses. They distribute paint directly to customers, which eliminates the need for wholesalers and increases external competition.

Retail businesses that sell paint, wallpaper, and related products buy from paint wholesalers. Due to economic uncertainty, the industry has seen swings in demand, particularly in the value of construction and industrial production.

The threat of manufacturers selling directly to retailers and other end users is becoming more prevalent for traditional paint wholesalers. This would prevent retailers from using wholesalers as middlemen to reach their customers.

Several significant companies, including Sherwin-Williams, PPG Industries and Benjamin Moore, dominate the market. These businesses control a substantial portion of the market. The majority of the market is made up of architectural and decorative paints.
The industry is highly competitive, with companies competing on factors such as price, quality, innovation and customer service.
Consolidation is a prevalent trend in the industry, with larger players acquiring smaller competitors to expand their product offerings and geographic reach.
Similar to other wholesaling industries that sell chemical products, paint wholesalers are subject to environmental laws and regulations.
By raising the cost of imported wholesale goods, certain tariffs on imported paint products indirectly benefit the industry.
Profit varies widely from business to business depending on the scope of operations, market niche and location.
The industry has a low level of technological innovation together with a low concentration.
The geographic spread of wholesalers closely follows that of the Paint Manufacturing industry and wholesale operators' major markets.

As the value of construction increases, so does aggregate demand for construction materials such as paints and other coatings. Paint is a necessary input in the successful completion of all construction projects, including

market_segmentation.segment_description: This market includes local independent paint stores, hardware stores and mass merchandisers, including larger home improvement department chains such as Home Depot and Lowe's. Demand from retailers has grown. Paint manufacturers, such as Sherwin-Williams and PPG, are increasingly internalizing wholesale and retail operations into their businesses, eating away
For example, major player Sherwin-Williams operates more than 4,000 retail paint outlets across the United States.

Several manufacturing industries use paints and coatings in the production process, most notably automobile and industrial appliance and equipment manufacturers. For example, automobile manufacturers use industry products to paint new cars and use finish coatings to protect the painted surface from rust, scratches and other environmental damage.

Special purpose industrial coatings are used to limit and control the corrosion of steel structures, such as offshore platforms, bridges and underground pipelines. Other applications include fire-resistant coatings used on steel and concrete structures, such as the lining of a traffic tunnel.

Repair shops exhibit considerable demand for special-purpose coatings for work on vehicles, appliances, vintage furniture and other commodities. Paint, varnish, resin, and other coatings are used to remove flaws, scratches and other signs of wear and tear from damaged items.

products_and_services.product_description: Interior and exterior oil- and latex-based paints, primers and a vast array of other coating and building products are examples of architectural coating products. These goods are distributed through a range of retail channels, including home improvement stores, construction material wholesalers and independent paint dealers that sell to building contractors directly.

Special-purpose coatings are typically applied in the field, whereas industrial coatings are typically applied during the manufacturing process, even if they are comparable to goods in the industrial coatings market. Products include maritime paints, spray paint, fluorescent and ultraviolet-sensitive dyes, traffic and highway markings, high-performance maintenance coatings and vehicle repainting and repair coatings.
Industrial coatings, commonly referred to as original equipment manufacturers (OEM), are used internally as part of the manufacturing process

products_and_services.product_or_service: Other, including Painting Supplies and Accessories
products_and_services.product_description: Industry wholesalers offer a wide range of accessories, including paintbrushes, rollers, masks, drop cloths, paint trays, tape and other various painting tools, to go along with their assortment of paint and coatings. In this category, wall putty, pigment-dispersing solvents and paint thinners and strippers may all be sold by business owners.

There are several types of wallpaper, such as vinyl-coated paper, fabric, solid-sheet vinyl and coated paper. Vinyl-coated wallpaper products are generally more durable and less expensive and thus in higher demand than traditional paper-coated products.

tier_1_suppliers: Hand Tool & Cutlery Manufacturing in the US
Soap & Cleaning Compound Manufacturing in the US
Metal Can & Container Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Dye & Pigment Manufacturing in the US
tier_1_buyers: Home Improvement Stores in the US
tier_2_buyers: Truck, Trailer & Motor Home Manufacturing in the US
Apartment & Condominium Construction in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: As the value of construction increases, so does aggregate demand for construction materials such as paints and other coatings. Paint is a necessary input in the successful completion of all construction projects, including residential home building and renovation to infrastructural construction and highway paving. The increasing value of construction represents a potential opportunity for to the industry.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region has a disproportionately high number of paint industry establishments (37%) compared to its population share (19%), suggesting it is an important hub for this industry.
The West region has a relatively balanced distribution of establishments (14%) compared to its population (23%).
The Mid-Atlantic region has a relatively balanced distribution of establishments (14%) compared to its population (15%).
The Great Lakes region has a relatively balanced distribution of establishments (13%) compared to its population (15%).
The Southwest region has fewer paint industry establishments (9%) relative to its population (11%).
The Plains region has fewer paint industry establishments (6%) relative to its population (7%).
The New England region has fewer paint industry establishments (5%) relative to its population (5%).
The Rocky Mountains region has fewer paint industry establishments (2%) relative to its population (5%).

regulations_points.regulation_description: The storage and disposal of paints and chemicals, as well as the removal of waste and byproducts, are all subject to municipal, state and federal requirements that must be followed by paint wholesalers.
Regulators governing the cross-state transportation of potentially hazardous materials (hazmat) present another challenge for operators who frequently move significant amounts of paint.

In response to the COVID-19 pandemic, health and safety regulations were implemented in 2020. According to these recommendations, establishments should maintain additional cleanliness measures and temporarily distance themselves from one another.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The industry is mature, indicating moderate barriers to entry.

basis_points.basis_description: Wholesale distributors can set themselves apart from rivals by offering value-added services like warranties, technical assistance or equipment repair.
Sherwin-Williams and PPG Industries are vertically integrated businesses that distribute paint directly to customers, eliminating the need for wholesalers and increasing external competition.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The industry is characterized by a low level of market share concentration and is highly fragmented, especially in the merchant wholesaling category.
The industry has undergone consolidation, primarily due to merger and acquisition activity as major players expand their geographic reach.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: THERE IS NOT MUCH PHYSICAL EQUIPMENT USED BY OPERATORS
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Depreciation costs for this industry are low due to the low capital required for participation. These expenses are primarily related to computerized inventory management systems and ordering platforms for the phone and internet, which help operators remain competitive.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: PURCHASES ARE THE LARGEST EXPENSE FOR THE INDUSTRY
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: A high expense ratio is common among wholesalers, as their primary function is to purchase large quantities of goods for downstream distribution to retailers and other markets. This cost segment has increased while entering the current period of 2023.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Labor is Essential to the Industry
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The industry has a low level of technological innovation together with a low concentration. Smaller players in the market have been unable to purchase and use pricey, automated sorting technology due to high costs and an inability to take advantage of economies of scale.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The Paint Wholesaling industry in the United States is moderately labor-intensive, with significant labor costs associated with order fulfillment, inventory management, customer service and technical support.
Paint wholesalers require a certain amount of capital to enter the industry, with infrastructure like warehouses, shelving, trucks and inventory software necessary to operations.

volatility_points.volatility_description: The performance of the construction and industrial manufacturing sectors, which have contrasted slightly, has a significant impact on industry revenue. Several downstream demand markets, including auto body shops, experienced a sharp decline in 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

During periods of economic growth, manufacturing output increases, which in turn drives demand for paints and coatings. Conversely, during economic downturns or periods of slow growth, manufacturing output declines, which can lead to a decline in demand for paint products.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: New product development is a key strategy used by companies in the paint wholesaling industry in the US to differentiate themselves from their competitors and meet changing customer needs. One example of a company that has successfully implemented this strategy is Sherwin-Williams, which introduced its Emerald line of paints.

Digitalization is a significant trend transforming the paint wholesaling industry in the US. Companies are increasingly investing in technology to streamline their operations, enhance customer experiences, and drive growth. One key aspect of digitalization in the industry is the development of e-commerce platforms and mobile applications.

FAQs.question: How does your company maintain a competitive edge in such a crowded industry?
FAQs.answer: Wholesale paint suppliers maintain a competitive edge by producing paint on a large scale, thus cutting down on production costs per unit.

FAQs.question: How have your sales been affected by the growth of online shopping?
FAQs.answer: The growth of online wholesale stores has not significantly affected paint wholesalers.

FAQs.question: How do you manage volatile demand that results from economic conditions or seasonality?
FAQs.answer: Wholesalers are able to adjust their purchase orders from manufacturers in times of waning demand unless bound by contract.

FAQs.question: How does the size of your company affect its profitability and growth potential?
FAQs.answer: The merchant wholesalers category is highly fragmented, represented by a large number of small operators that compete on a regional basis. The MSBOs category is highly concentrated, dominated by a small number of large operators with global operations. Large wholesalers are much more profitable.

FAQs.question: Does your company use RFID to optimize inventory management and improve efficiency?
FAQs.answer: The introduction of inventory management technology has improved profit margins in the industry. However, other factors such as input prices also affect.

FAQs.question: How has your company been able to implement technology into the purchasing process to make buying more efficient for customers?
FAQs.answer: Retailers can expedite the purchasing process by ordering online from wholesale distributors.

FAQs.question: How have you adjusted to new regulations over the past decade? How have you handled compliance costs?
FAQs.answer: The industry has implemented eco-friendly products in response to stricter environmental guidelines.

FAQs.question: How does your company monitor potential changes to the regulatory environment?
FAQs.answer: By adhering strictly to government and industry guidelines. The industry was largely deemed an essential business, and therefore, must follow regulations to remain open.

FAQs.question: What financial challenges are likely to face?
FAQs.answer: Mounting competition from wholesale bypass, in which manufacturers sell directly to retail outlets.

FAQs.question: How does input price volatility affect your purchase costs and selling prices?
FAQs.answer: The volatile price of crude oil influences the price of paint and purchase costs.

FAQs.question: How many suppliers does the company have? Does the company rely heavily on one supplier?
FAQs.answer: Paint dealers must develop and maintain strong relations with upstream suppliers to perform well in this highly competitive industry. The main upstream supplier is paint manufacturers.

FAQs.question: How does the company gauge customer satisfaction? How does the company address customer feedback and incorporate any suggestions into the business?
FAQs.answer: Distributors need to provide excellent customer service to be successful. This includes competitive pricing strategies, delivery services, product training, color matching services and helping their customers navigate environmental regulations.

FAQs.question: How important is it to have good technical knowledge of the product? How often does the company provide training sessions for staff?
FAQs.answer: Successful companies have the ability to provide technical and product advice to clients directly without having to consult paint suppliers.

FAQs.question: How has the world price of crude oil affected your company's bottom line? Is your company prepared for the threat of higher input costs?
FAQs.answer: Crude oil and its derivatives are the primary ingredients of solvent-based paints, which make up a significant share of the paint selection offered by industry operators. Paint manufacturers contending with higher crude oil prices will pass down these input costs to wholesalers in the form of higher prices, which will reduce the wholesaler's profitability.

FAQs.question: How closely do you monitor the industrial production index? How is your company affected when the industrial production index decreases?
FAQs.answer: The level of activity in key manufacturing industries affects demand for coatings. In turn, increased demand for industrial coatings from these markets boosts demand for industry services.

FAQs.question: Does your demand trend in line with demand from construction companies? How do you offset demand during times of low construction?
FAQs.answer: As the total annual value of all construction developments increases, so does aggregate demand for construction materials such as paints and other coatings.
